testSchema: create table t1(a int, b int)
create table t2(x int, y int)

testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list in case with only from and select-list

testCases.testQuery: select b+1 from vs.t1 where t1.b>7
testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list and WHERE-clause

Oracle: SELECT CAST(("B" + 1) AS FLOAT) FROM "LS"."T1" WHERE 7 < "B"

testCases.testQuery: select b+1 from vs.t1 join vs.t2 on a=x where t1.b>7
testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list, join and WHERE-clause

Exasol: SELECT ("T1"."B" + 1) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B"
PostgreSQL: SELECT ("t1"."b" + 1) FROM "ls"."t1" INNER JOIN "ls"."t2" ON "t1"."a" = "t2"."x" WHERE 7 < "t1"."b"
Oracle: SELECT CAST(("T1"."B" + 1) AS FLOAT) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B"
Hive: SELECT (`T1`.`B` + 1) FROM `LS`.`T1` INNER JOIN `LS`.`T2` ON `T1`.`A` = `T2`.`X` WHERE 7 < `T1`.`B`

testCases.testQuery: select b+1 from vs.t1 join vs.t2 on a=x where t1.b>7 order by t2.y limit 3 offset 1
testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list, join and WHERE-clause, ORDER BY and LIMIT

Exasol: SELECT ("T1"."B" + 1) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" ORDER BY "T2"."Y" LIMIT 3 OFFSET 1
PostgreSQL: SELECT ("t1"."b" + 1) FROM "ls"."t1" INNER JOIN "ls"."t2" ON "t1"."a" = "t2"."x" WHERE 7 < "t1"."b" ORDER BY "t2"."y" LIMIT 3 OFFSET 1
Oracle: SELECT c0 FROM ( SELECT LIMIT_SUBSELECT.*, ROWNUM ROWNUM_SUB FROM ( SELECT CAST(("T1"."B" + 1) AS FLOAT) AS c0 FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" ORDER BY "T2"."Y"  ) LIMIT_SUBSELECT WHERE ROWNUM <= 4 ) WHERE ROWNUM_SUB > 1
Hive: SELECT (`T1`.`B` + 1) FROM `LS`.`T1` INNER JOIN `LS`.`T2` ON `T1`.`A` = `T2`.`X` WHERE 7 < `T1`.`B` ORDER BY `T2`.`Y` NULLS LAST LIMIT 3 OFFSET 1

testCases.testQuery: select sum(b+1) from vs.t1 join vs.t2 on a=x where t1.b>7
testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list with aggregation, join and WHERE-clause

Exasol: SELECT SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B"
PostgreSQL: SELECT SUM(("t1"."b" + 1)) FROM "ls"."t1" INNER JOIN "ls"."t2" ON "t1"."a" = "t2"."x" WHERE 7 < "t1"."b"
Oracle: SELECT CAST(SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) AS FLOAT) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B"
Hive: SELECT SUM((`T1`.`B` + 1)) FROM `LS`.`T1` INNER JOIN `LS`.`T2` ON `T1`.`A` = `T2`.`X` WHERE 7 < `T1`.`B`

testCases.testQuery: select sum(b+1) from vs.t1 join vs.t2 on a=x where t1.b>7 group by a,y
testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list with aggregation, join and WHERE-clause, GROUP BY

Exasol: SELECT SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" GROUP BY "T1"."A", "T2"."Y"
PostgreSQL: SELECT SUM(("t1"."b" + 1)) FROM "ls"."t1" INNER JOIN "ls"."t2" ON "t1"."a" = "t2"."x" WHERE 7 < "t1"."b" GROUP BY "t1"."a", "t2"."y"
Oracle: SELECT CAST(SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) AS FLOAT) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" GROUP BY "T1"."A", "T2"."Y"
Hive: SELECT SUM((`T1`.`B` + 1)) FROM `LS`.`T1` INNER JOIN `LS`.`T2` ON `T1`.`A` = `T2`.`X` WHERE 7 < `T1`.`B` GROUP BY `T1`.`A`, `T2`.`Y`

testCases.testQuery: select sum(b+1) from vs.t1 join vs.t2 on a=x where t1.b>7 group by a,y having sum(x) > 0
testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list with aggregation, join and WHERE-clause, GROUP BY, HAVING

Exasol: SELECT SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" GROUP BY "T1"."A", "T2"."Y" HAVING 0 < SUM("T2"."X")
PostgreSQL: SELECT SUM(("t1"."b" + 1)) FROM "ls"."t1" INNER JOIN "ls"."t2" ON "t1"."a" = "t2"."x" WHERE 7 < "t1"."b" GROUP BY "t1"."a", "t2"."y" HAVING 0 < SUM("t2"."x")
Oracle: SELECT CAST(SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) AS FLOAT) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" GROUP BY "T1"."A", "T2"."Y" HAVING 0 < SUM("T2"."X")
Hive: SELECT SUM((`T1`.`B` + 1)) FROM `LS`.`T1` INNER JOIN `LS`.`T2` ON `T1`.`A` = `T2`.`X` WHERE 7 < `T1`.`B` GROUP BY `T1`.`A`, `T2`.`Y` HAVING 0 < SUM(`T2`.`X`)

testCases.testQuery: select sum(b+1) from vs.t1 join vs.t2 on a=x where t1.b>7 group by a,y having sum(x) > 0 order by sum(y+1) limit 3 offset 1
testCases.testDescription: Full pushdown with select-list with aggregation, join and WHERE-clause, GROUP BY, HAVING, ORDER BY and LIMIT

Exasol: SELECT SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" GROUP BY "T1"."A", "T2"."Y" HAVING 0 < SUM("T2"."X") ORDER BY SUM(("T2"."Y" + 1)) LIMIT 3 OFFSET 1
PostgreSQL: SELECT SUM(("t1"."b" + 1)) FROM "ls"."t1" INNER JOIN "ls"."t2" ON "t1"."a" = "t2"."x" WHERE 7 < "t1"."b" GROUP BY "t1"."a", "t2"."y" HAVING 0 < SUM("t2"."x") ORDER BY SUM(("t2"."y" + 1)) LIMIT 3 OFFSET 1
Oracle: SELECT c0 FROM ( SELECT LIMIT_SUBSELECT.*, ROWNUM ROWNUM_SUB FROM ( SELECT CAST(SUM(("T1"."B" + 1)) AS FLOAT) AS c0 FROM "LS"."T1" INNER JOIN "LS"."T2" ON "T1"."A" = "T2"."X" WHERE 7 < "T1"."B" GROUP BY "T1"."A", "T2"."Y" HAVING 0 < SUM("T2"."X") ORDER BY SUM(("T2"."Y" + 1))  ) LIMIT_SUBSELECT WHERE ROWNUM <= 4 ) WHERE ROWNUM_SUB > 1
Hive: SELECT SUM((`T1`.`B` + 1)) FROM `LS`.`T1` INNER JOIN `LS`.`T2` ON `T1`.`A` = `T2`.`X` WHERE 7 < `T1`.`B` GROUP BY `T1`.`A`, `T2`.`Y` HAVING 0 < SUM(`T2`.`X`) ORDER BY SUM((`T2`.`Y` + 1)) NULLS LAST LIMIT 3 OFFSET 1
